text: Monocyte / macrophages may harbor HIV in a nonproductive fashion for prolonged periods of time .
Viral gene expression may be reactivated by stimulation of the cells with LPS or cytokines such as <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in vitro .

The effect of LPS and <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is mediated by their ability to induce nuclear translocation of the DNA - binding heterodimer NF-kappa B ( <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , which binds to a specific sequence in the HIV-long terminal repeat .

text: Taken together , these observations suggest that HIV gene expression may be activated in infected monocytes through interaction of the cells with complement-opsonized particles and that enhanced viral replication is associated with C3 receptor - mediated nuclear translocation of the NF-kappa B complex .
